By moving your finger, you create random data (called entropy) that is used to generate the keypair associated with your new unique Threema ID. The keypair consists of a public key that is distributed to your contacts and a private key that is safely stored on your phone. Your contacts will encrypt messages to you with your public key. Only the owner of the private key and nobody else is able to decrypt these messages.
